thread.title: Two injured as burqa-clad militants open fire in south Kashmir
thread.title_full: Two injured as burqa-clad militants open fire in south Kashmir

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Two injured as burqa-clad militants open fire in south Kashmir
text:
Majid Jahangir
Tribune News Service
Srinagar, October 16
Two civilians were injured after suspected militants attacked a party of Special Operation Group (SOG) of the Jammu and Kashmir Police in south Kashmir’s Pulwama district this afternoon. A burqa-clad accomplice of the attackers was arrested after the shootout by the Army. Sources said burqa-clad militant opened fire on the police party near the bus stand of Pulwama, 32 kms from here at around 12.30 pm. Sources said two civilians identified as Rahti and Riyaz Ahmed – both residents of Arihal Pulwama were injured in the firing incident. The two injured were rushed to a hospital in Pulwama. Soon after the shooting, panic gripped the entire town and the shopkeepers downed their shutters. A police officer said they received an information regarding the presence of militants at bus stand Pulwama. “A police team along with the CRPF immediately rushed to the spot. There they saw some suspicious looking people along with a burqa-clad women sitting in a sumo. When they directed them to come down the vehicle, they fired indiscriminate and ran away from the spot. Police showed restraint and did not retaliate as there were many people around,” the officer said. "The troops, meanwhile, chased them and were able to arrest one of their burqa accomplice," he said. Police sources identified the arrested as Tariq Ahmed, an over ground worker of a militant group. “Further investigation in the shootout is going on,” the police said.
